question: How many Super Bowls have the 49ers won?
summary: The 49ers are 5-1 in Super Bowls, beating the Bengals in 1982, the Dolphins in 1985, the Bengals again in 1989, the Broncos in 1990 and the Chargers in 1995 before losing to the Ravens in 2013.
caption: 49ers players celebrate their fifth title. AP Photo/Susan Walsh

question: Jerry Rice holds the Super Bowl record for career touchdowns. How many did he score?
summary: Jerry Rice had eight career touchdowns, scoring three in a game twice, including the 49ers' win over the San Diego Chargers in Super Bowl XXIX, when he had 10 receptions for 149 yards and 3 touchdowns -- while playing with a separated shoulder for much of the game.
caption: Jerry Rice has celebrated more than anyone. Ray Stubblebine

question: Who holds the 49ers’ record for most yards rushing in a Super Bowl?
summary: In Super Bowl XLVII, Frank Gore had 19 carries for 110 yards and a touchdown, but the 49ers lost 34-31 to the Baltimore Ravens.
caption: Frank Gore against the Ravens. Brant Ward/ The Chronicle

question: In which stadium did the 49ers win multiple Super Bowl titles?
summary: Joe Montana was cool down the stretch in a 20-16 Super Bowl XXIII win over the Cincinnati Bengals at Joe Robbie Stadium in 1989. Six years later, Steve Young grounded the Chargers there, 49-26.
caption: Steve Young, Steve Wallace and the 49ers cruised at Joe Robbie.  Doug Collier/AFP/Getty Images

question: Which Raider is the only player in Super Bowl history with three interceptions in a single game?
summary: Raiders linebacker Rod Martin intercepted Ron Jaworski three times in Super Bowl XV, but somehow lost MVP honors to Jim Plunkett, once again demonstrating the media's ridiculous quarterback bias.
caption: Rod Martin (53) registers three picks against the Eagles. Getty Images

question: Who scored the Raiders' first Super Bowl touchdown?
summary: Bill Miller scored both Raiders' touchdowns in their 33-14 loss to the Packers in Super Bowl II. Miller had five catches on the day -- and just 49 total in his four seasons with the Raiders.
caption: Bill Miller (89) scored both Raiders touchdowns in Super Bowl II. Getty Images

question: Who holds the Raiders’ record for career Super Bowl touchdowns with three?
summary: In the Raiders' three Super Bowl wins, Cliff Branch caught a combined 14 passes for 181 yards and three touchdowns. Many fans think he should be in the Hall of Fame over the Steelers' Lynn Swann.
caption: Cliff Branch catches a TD from Jim Plunkett. UPI photo

question: How many interceptions did the Tampa Bay Buccaneers return for touchdowns in their 48-21 win over the Raiders in Super Bowl XXXVII?
summary: Rich Gannon threw a Super Bowl-record five interceptions, with three of them being run back all the way. Dwight Smith returned both of his picks for touchdowns, and Derrick Brooks added a pick six. MVP Dexter Jackson also had two interceptions.
caption: Rich Gannon threw five interceptions, three were returned for scores. AP Photo/David J. Phillip

question: Who scored the 49ers’ first Super Bowl touchdown?
summary: This is one of the few feats Jerry Rice doesn't hold. The first touchdown was actually scored by Joe Montana on a 1-yard sneak to give San Francisco a 7–0 lead in Super Bowl XVI.
caption: Joe Montana runs for a score. Getty Images

question: What is Jerry Rice’s Super Bowl record for receiving yards in a game?
summary: Jerry Rice had 11 receptions for 215 yards and one touchdown in the 49ers' 20-16 win over the Cincinnati Bengals in Super Bowl XXIII. He was named MVP.
caption: Jerry Rice dominated the Bengals.  Ronald C. Modra/ Getty Images

question: When the 49ers lost 34-31 to the Ravens three years ago, they tied the record for most points by a losing team. Whose record did they tie?
summary: Terry Bradshaw passed for a then-record four touchdowns to lead the Steelers to a 35-31 victory over the Cowboys in Super Bowl XIII.
caption: Terry Bradshaw and the Steelers outscored the Cowboys. Getty Images

question: Who is the only quarterback in Super Bowl history to throw at least 100 career passes without an interception?
summary: Joe Montana completed 83 of 122 passes (68.0%) for 1,142 yards, 11 touchdowns and no interceptions in four Super Bowls -- all wins.
caption: Joe Montana never threw a Super Bowl interception. AP Photo

question: In Super Bowl XVIII, which Raider scored a touchdown on a recovery of a blocked punt in the end zone?
summary: Five minutes into Super Bowl XVIII, Derrick Jensen burst through the right side to block Jeff Hayes’ punt and recover Washington's fumble in the end zone.
caption: Derrick Jensen (31) blocks a punt. Getty Images

question: Who was the first wild-card team to win a Super Bowl?
summary: The Raiders defeated the Philadelphia Eagles 27-10  in Super Bowl XV in New Orleans, becoming the first wild-card team to win the championship.
caption: Jim Plunkett, left, congratulated by Dick Vermeil after Super Bowl XV. AP Photo/Pete Leabo

question: Who scored the longest touchdown in Raiders Super Bowl history?
summary: Kenny King took a short pass from Jim Plunkett and raced 80 yards to the endzone in Super Bowl XV. It's longer than two more famous plays: Marcus Allen's zig-zag run of 74 yards against Washington and Willie Brown's 75-yard interception return against Minnesota.
caption: Kenny King burns the Eagles for 80 yards. Nate Fine/Getty Images
